subject: Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: A different ordering could benefit Lexicographers of QS: having all possible variations of words immediately next to each other in alphabetical order would
messageBody:
A different ordering could benefit Lexicographers of QS: having all
possible variations of words immediately next to each other in
alphabetical order would very desirable.

The recent investigation with lexical sets seems to show the limits of
spelling variation and hints that this may be possible. We now know
what set of vowels might be used for a given word and, more
importantly, what won't be.

If all the QS letters that can be used in a given lexical are right
next to each other in alphabetical order then every word from every
accent will be next to each other.

Example 1: among all accents, there are only two ways to spell "bath":
Bay-At-Thaw and Bay-Ah-Thaw. If At and Ah were next to each other,
both forms of "bath" would be next to each other in alphabetic
ordering. Likewise any word that sounds like bath will have both
variations together.

Example 2: there are only three ways to spell "cloth" Key-Low-Ah-Thaw,
Key-Low-Awe-Thaw, Key-Low-Ox-Thaw. If Ah, Awe and Ox are next to each
other, all variations of the word "cloth" will be next to each other
as will every triad of words with that vowel.

So far all way have to do is switch #30At and #31Ice but...

There's a problem: there's one too many QS letters to make this work.
Consider where to put Ox:
- if we leave the Ah, Awe and Ox in their current order, the two
spellings of "lot" will not be next to each other.
-if we switch Awe with Ox then the two spellings of "thought" will not
be together.
-if the order were At, Ox, Ah then the two spellings of Bath won't be
together.


Some choices, in reverse order of outrageousness:
1. re-examine the way lexical sets are assigned.
2. give up on an alphabetical ordering that puts all word of all
accents together.
3. get rid of a letter (presumably merging Awe and Ox)



--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "tinyallen" <Tinyallen@...> wrote:
>
> Big question: Do we need to change the alphabetic order of
QuickScript?
>
> If so, this would impact the Unicode submission.
>
> In the context of the recent discussions on morpheme blending
> (lexical sets, phonemes and all that) it was brought out that
> alphabetical ordering of the merged letter sets should be adjacent.
>
> 1. Is the current ordering 'good enough' for (say) titles in one
> dialect to be findable by someone using another dialect?
>
> 2. If that is not good enough, what is the optimal ordering? One
> question I have is whether it would be better to have the vowels at
> the beginning of the alphabet rather than at the end.
>
> Comments are highly requested.
>
